intro: Gaura drummondii, commonly known as Drummond's gaura, is a flowering plant native to the central and southern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces clusters of delicate, pink or white, tubular flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes. Its airy appearance and showy blooms make it a valuable addition to native plant gardens.
